intro: Cyclodium inerme, commonly known as the common cyclodium, is a low-growing annual plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Cyclodium inerme is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
